alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 11:03AM CDT until March 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, River traffic and industrial activity on the river side of the levees will be greatly affected. Navigational safety regulations will be strictly enforced. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 35.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting and expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. It will continue falling to 29.1 feet Wednesday, April 20. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.6 feet on 04/16/1874. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
